text: You can adjust many preferences using the [Settings Dialog](https://www.pgdp.net/wiki/PPTools/Guiguts/Guiguts_2_Manual/Edit_Menu#Settings).
For example, you can enable or disable these "Did You Know...?" tips.
You can use the [Command Palette](https://www.pgdp.net/wiki/PPTools/Guiguts/Guiguts_2_Manual/Help_Menu#Command_Palette) to quickly find any menu command.
Just press Ctrl+Shift+P (or Cmd+Shift+P on Macs) to open it and start typing part of the command.
Add your own shortcuts using the [Custom Menu](https://www.pgdp.net/wiki/PPTools/Guiguts/Guiguts_2_Manual/Custom_Menu).
You can open webpages or run tools on your computer, as well as pass the selected text to the webpage or tool.
You can [split the main text window](https://www.pgdp.net/wiki/PPTools/Guiguts/Guiguts_2_Manual/View_Menu#Split_Text_Window) to view two parts of your text at the same time.
Use Tab and Shift-Tab shortcuts to switch focus between the two views.
Use [Undo/Redo](https://www.pgdp.net/wiki/PPTools/Guiguts/Guiguts_2_Manual/Edit_Menu#Undo_and_Redo) to quickly revert changes in the text.
Keyboard shortcuts match your platform: Ctrl+Z/Cmd+Z for undo, Ctrl+Y/Cmd+Shift+Z for redo.
